item.title: Cracked road surface and dip in road, 3rd December
item.description:
Cracked road surface which has caused a dip in the road, has got worse over the last 6 months. Cars swerve to avoid it so in need of a repair/resurface. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashbourne Avenue, West Heath, Greater London

item.title: Bags left by roadsweeper, 3rd December
item.description:
The road was finally swept yesterday, after more than a month. The road sweeper left a large number of bags, which have now been here since yesterday morning. They are already attracting more litter and will be ripped open and the contents spread about if not removed promptly.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ingledew Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 bags mixed waste, 3rd December
item.description:
3 black bags, one of them is leaking something brown which might be oil. By the bins at the entrance to McDermott Grove Park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17b, Costa Street, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned caravan located in Crabtree Manorway South, Belvedere., 3rd December
item.description:
There is an abandoned caravan located in Crabtree Manorway South, Belvedere. Due to its condition, the caravan is causing a potential hazard to other vehicle users and pedestrians. I would be grateful if Bexley Council could take action to identify the registered owner and remove the caravan as soon as possible please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crabtree Manorway South, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign still not been removed and was reported 7th Nov- now completely fallen in to pavement, 3rd December
item.description:
This sign has been here for a month now and has still not been removed despite being reported and now people have fly tipped paint beside it. Noticed the same sign is missing from the junction of Half Moon and Burbage Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Half Moon Lane, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping and shattered glass on Indus Road near dentist, 3rd December
item.description:
There is shattered glass on the pavement and alightly further up, gas canisters and on the right hans aide lots of rubbish that has been left in a little alleyway (fly tipping)

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Indus Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Growing Pile of Rubbish by Domestic Flats, 3rd December
item.description:
There's been a growing pile of rubbish thats appeared outside our building just under the railway arch for a few days now. None of the residents know why it has suddenly appeared, but more seems to be being added to it each day. Several residents have now complained and nothing has been done. Please can this be cleaned up and the source investigated? It contains rotting food waste. This is unhygienic and unsightly. Many thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 235-241, Union Street, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Flytipping on the footpath, 3rd December
item.description:
